attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: That Weston Constituency Labour Party, in order that the democratic deficit may be addressed, calls on the Government to replace the South West Regional Assembly with a directly elected regional assembly at the same time as organising a campaign to win public support for a directly elected assembly.  In addition, to put together a cross-party convention on the governance of England south of The Wash, involving a range of interested parties such as trades unions and businesses, to revisit the Redcliffe-Maud Report and to consider alternatives such as proposed in Senior’s Memorandum of Dissent.

reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
